powerPlants.name: Solar Cell
powerPlants.description: The solar cell converts light and heat energy from a nearby star into shipboard power through large banks of highly efficient photovoltaic cells and heat exchangers. Power generation varies based on distance from the star.

powerPlants.name: Fission Generator
powerPlants.description: Also known as an atomic or nuclear power plant, the fission generator extracts energy from a controlled chain reaction of uranium or plutonium. Requires heavy shielding, so small installations are very difficult.

powerPlants.name: Fusion Generator
powerPlants.description: A fusion generator harnesses the power of nuclear fusion to create shipboard power. A containment device 'bottles' the reaction in magnetic fields, since the generator's core burns at temperatures as hot as the surface of a star.

powerPlants.name: Grav-Fusion Cell
powerPlants.description: Based on a fraal device, the grav-fusion cell employs artificial gravity fields to contain and enhance the performance of a fusion reaction. It's otherwise similar to the fusion generator.

powerPlants.name: Antimatter Reactor
powerPlants.description: The antimatter reactor annihilates particles of antimatter to create vast amounts of power. Requires careful containment procedures. No fuel tank is required - the antimatter and its containment device are included.

powerPlants.name: Mass Reactor
powerPlants.description: Dark matter technology presumes that nonbaryonic dark matter may have properties unknown to 20th century science. The decay of dark matter into 'normal' matter releases immense amounts of energy.

powerPlants.name: Tachyonic Collider
powerPlants.description: Tachyons are particles that move faster than the speed of light. The tachyonic collider slows these particles and harnesses their energy. While expensive and doesn't provide as much power, it has one significant advantage: no fuel required.

powerPlants.name: Dynamic Mass Reactor
powerPlants.description: Basically a refinement of the PL 7 mass reactor, the dynamic mass reactor accelerates the decay process, releasing more energy than its predecessor. It's also a smaller and safer installation.

powerPlants.name: Matter Converter
powerPlants.description: This device produces energy through the total conversion of matter. Literally anything can be used as fuel. While expensive, it produces an immense amount of power and requires no significant fuel source.

powerPlants.name: Quantum Cell
powerPlants.description: Harnessing the Holy Grail of energy sources - the quantum fluctuation or zero-point energy observed in vacuum - the quantum cell produces an enormous amount of energy from no fuel source at all.

powerPlants.name: Singularity Generator
powerPlants.description: The singularity generator is an incredibly powerful device that taps the power of a small black hole. It's not a generator so much as an extremely capacious battery, but the energy contained in a tiny black hole is staggering.
